pychell API reference¶

Noise Kernels¶

class pychell.orbits.rvkernels.RVColor(data, par_names=None, wavelength0=550)¶

Bases: optimize.kernels.GaussianProcess

Constructs a generic GP. Should be called by any class that extends this class.

Parameters

  • data (MixedData) – The mixed data objects which utilize this noise kernel. The combined and sorted x variables will form the axes for the covariance matrix.

  • par_names (list) – A list of parameter names. They must be provided in the order specified by the appropriate kernel.

compute_data_errors(pars)¶

Computes the errors added in quadrature for all datasets corresponding to this kernel.

Parameters

pars (Parameters) – The parameters to use.

Returns

The errors

Return type

np.ndarray

compute_dist_matrix(x1=None, x2=None, wave1=None, wave2=None)¶

Computes the distance matrix.

Parameters

  • x1 (np.ndarray) – [description]

  • x2 (np.ndarray) – [description]

  • instname (str, optional) – The name of the instrument this is for. Defaults to None.

compute_wave_matrix(wave1=None, wave2=None)¶

Generates a matrix for a linear kernel.

Parameters

  • wave1 (float, optional) – [description]. Defaults to the data wavelengths.

  • wave2 (float, optional) – The wavelength for the second axis. Defaults to the data wavelengths.

realize(pars, residuals, xpred=None, xres=None, return_unc=False, wavelength=None)¶

Realize the GP (predict/ssample at arbitrary points). Meant to be the same as the predict method offered by other codes.

Parameters

  • pars (Parameters) – The parameters to use.

  • residuals (np.ndarray) – The residuals before the GP is subtracted.

  • xpred (np.ndarray) – The vector to realize the GP on.

  • xres (np.ndarray) – The vector the data is on.

  • errors (np.ndarray) – The errorbars, already added in quadrature.

  • wavelength (float) – The wavelength to realize the GP for.

  • return_unc (bool, optional) – Whether or not to compute the uncertainty in the GP. If True, both the mean and stddev are returned in a tuple. Defaults to False.

Returns

If stddev is False, only the mean GP is returned. If stddev is True, the uncertainty in the GP is computed and returned as well. The mean GP is computed through a linear optimization.

Return type

np.ndarray OR tuple

class pychell.orbits.rvkernels.RVColor2(data, par_names=None, wavelength0=550)¶

Bases: pychell.orbits.rvkernels.RVColor

Constructs a generic GP. Should be called by any class that extends this class.

Parameters

  • data (MixedData) – The mixed data objects which utilize this noise kernel. The combined and sorted x variables will form the axes for the covariance matrix.

  • par_names (list) – A list of parameter names. They must be provided in the order specified by the appropriate kernel.
